author: Ira Iosebashvili
title: Dollar Falls After Soft Inflation Data
text:
The dollar fell Thursday, after weaker-than-expected inflation data pushed some investors to lock in profits on the U.S. currencyâ€™s recent run.
The WSJ Dollar Index, which measures the U.S. currency against a basket of 16 others, was recently down 0.2% at 86.46 on losses against the euro, yen and a broad range of emerging markets.
